messages.message:
Resurfacing this old thread as I can't find a better answer to this (here in Slack or in Confluence): *What's the process for adding credits to our accounts on AI Hub Prod?*

I'm working on a Build app and testing out Chatbots and ran out of credits even though I'm using my IB account and it's been confirmed to be a part of the IB org.

@Nathaniel, this should help:
I reached out to IT about something similar and they sent me this guide :slightly_smiling_face::


> https://docs.google.com/document/d/19h-Qb_W8NfXIXcZQLA1vw0TAWCMZukmiXbqAdFxfxo4/edit
NOTE: You may need to reach out to IT yourself should you find you don't have access to `AI Hub Sandbox (dev/dogfood)` or `Instabase-GTM (preprod)`
also, make sure you are using the commercial context
Thanks!  I'd followed that guide, but it turns out I was signed into my IB account that doesn't feature `+aihubprod` in my email address. :facepalm:

Adding for future search-ability, in case anyone else looks for the answer to this:
• It seems like everyone within the Instabase org on AI Hub Prod gets unlimited credits.
• To be in the org,
    ◦ First, follow this guide: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19h-Qb_W8NfXIXcZQLA1vw0TAWCMZukmiXbqAdFxfxo4/edit
    ◦ Then, make sure that you're signed into AI Hub via your `<first>.<last>+<mailto:aihubprod@instabase.com|aihubprod@instabase.com>` account.
• If you're signed into AI Hub prod, via the _Sign in with Google_ SSO, even if you're signed in with an @instabase.com account, you may run out of credits.
I wonder if it's worth also maybe adding this to on-boarding resources for new hires.
